formattedAddress: 21 E 87th St, New York, NY 10128, USA
adrFormatAddress: 21 E 87th St, New York, NY 10128, USA

originalText.text: First of all almost no waiting time in the waiting room which was fantastic. Dr Joerg Is a very friendly doctor with a lot of positive energy. She listened to and addressed all my concerns and I received the appropriate treatment. I highly recommend.

text.text: First of all almost no waiting time in the waiting room which was fantastic. Dr Joerg Is a very friendly doctor with a lot of positive energy. She listened to and addressed all my concerns and I received the appropriate treatment. I highly recommend.

originalText.text: My wife and I have been seeing Dr. Joerg for many years. She has one of the best bedside manners of any doctors we've ever had. Always has a smile on her face. She's very thorough and we feel like we're in good hands.

text.text: My wife and I have been seeing Dr. Joerg for many years. She has one of the best bedside manners of any doctors we've ever had. Always has a smile on her face. She's very thorough and we feel like we're in good hands.

originalText.text: Dr. Joerg is a capable doctor.  Unfortunately, the administration of her appointments is appalling.  On my first visit, I waited OVER AN HOUR to see her.  I respectfully discussed this with her; she said that she gives all of her patients as much time as they need.  And while this wreaks havoc on her calendar, I respected the response... and thought I'd give her a 2nd chance.  But this time, I made my appointment early -- 9:30 am, thinking for sure she'd be on time.  After waiting for THIRTY-FIVE minutes, I left.  Another woman in the waiting room commented that she, too, had waited an hour for her last appointment.  This is very disrespectful.  There are thousands of capable doctors in NYC; I will be finding one who can keep an appointment schedule.

originalText.text:
I had two appointments scheduled with Dr Meryl, the first one was 10:15 and while I was on the train they called me and cancelled it saying there was an emergency. This was 9:40. I accepted the emergency and wished them well.

Two months later, I made another appointment, again, while I’m on the train I call to make sure everything is good before I come in. I received confirmation and everything via text.

This time the front desk says that my appointment was cancelled and Dr is not in. How is that possible? Why schedule and cancel without any notice. Not only was this very unprofessional but their Zocdoc is also misleading.

Never booking again.

text.text:
I had two appointments scheduled with Dr Meryl, the first one was 10:15 and while I was on the train they called me and cancelled it saying there was an emergency. This was 9:40. I accepted the emergency and wished them well.

Two months later, I made another appointment, again, while I’m on the train I call to make sure everything is good before I come in. I received confirmation and everything via text.

This time the front desk says that my appointment was cancelled and Dr is not in. How is that possible? Why schedule and cancel without any notice. Not only was this very unprofessional but their Zocdoc is also misleading.

Never booking again.

originalText.text: I liked the doctor very much and the staff in the examination room. She was personable and very competent. The appt was 11.45 and I didn’t get in until 12.20 which made my following appt time sensitive so I I had to take a cab. Two other things- one of the receptionists (Rosa?) refused to bring her mask up over her nose and was very defiant about it bordering on rude. And they charge a credit card fee on top of the $50 deductible which was not posted according to NY law. The doctor was excellent but these other issues re timeliness, the mask, and the fee were real negatives
